intro: Borkhausenia, commonly known as the African rock fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It consists of several species native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. These plants are characterized by their woody stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers. The fruits are typically fig-like, enclosed in a tough, fleshy capsule. Borkhausenia species are often found in rocky or arid environments, showing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions.
